alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Bath (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Alleghany and southwestern Bath Counties in west central Virginia through 415 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms near Carloover, or near Clifton Forge, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clifton Forge... Hot Springs... Lake Moomaw... Douthat State Park... Ingalls Field... Carloover... and Bacova Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
